zh: 我不想填这份问卷，项目太多了。

en: This album reminds me of my happy school days.
zh: 这本相册让我想起快乐的学生时代。

en: I never see this album without thinking of my high school days.
zh: 我每次看到这本相册都会想起我的高中时光。

en: I must point out that we need to clarify the meaning of this over-used concept.
zh: 我必须指出，我们需要明确这个被滥用概念的含义。

en: Six families live in this apartment house.
zh: 这栋公寓里住了六户人家。

en: This apartment is bigger than any other one in the building.
zh: 这套公寓比这栋楼里其他任何一间都大。

en: I can not bear living in this apartment any longer.
zh: 我再也受不了住在这公寓里了。

en: I like this apartment so much that I wouldn't move for the world.
zh: 我太喜欢这套公寓了，打死我也不搬走。

en: When you walk around here, you have to look out for falling rocks.
zh: 在这附近走的时候，得当心落石。

en: May I show you around?
zh: 要我带你四处转转吗？

en: The current is rapid around here.
zh: 这儿水流挺急的。

en: Telephone booths are as scarce as hen's teeth around here.
zh: 这附近几乎见不到公用电话亭。

en: There are few places to park around here.
zh: 这附近不太好停车。

en: We do not have snow here.
zh: 我们这儿不下雪。

en: There used to be rice fields around here.
zh: 这附近以前全是稻田。

en: There are few houses around here.
zh: 这附近没几户人家。

en: There is a dense population of young people around here.
zh: 这附近年轻人挺多的。

en: The area has been built up since I came here.
zh: 自从我来了以后，这儿楼盖得越来越多了。

en: The air is pure around here.
zh: 这儿空气挺清新的。

en: I'm a stranger here.
zh: 我对这儿不熟。

en: This area has changed completely.
zh: 这一带全变样了。

en: What are the main sights around here?
zh: 这附近有什么好玩的景点吗？

en: Is there a post office around here?
zh: 这附近有邮局吗？

en: Is there a public phone around here?
zh: 这附近有公用电话吗？

en: Do you know of any good restaurant near here?
zh: 你知道这附近有什么好吃的餐馆吗？

en: Nobody by that name is to be found around here.
zh: 这儿没听说过有叫这名字的人。

en: I think it's somewhere around here.
zh: 我觉得就在这附近。

en: There was a car accident near here, wasn't there?
zh: 这附近出过车祸，对吧？

en: I lost my key about here.
zh: 我的钥匙大概就丢在这附近。

en: I was surprised to hear that she passed for a model here.
zh: 听说她在这儿被当成模特，我挺惊讶的。

en: They live on potatoes around here.
zh: 这儿的人靠吃土豆过活。

en: Please wait around for a while.
zh: 请在附近等一会儿。

en: Please let me off here.
zh: 请让我在这儿下车。

en: This new town is beautifully laid out.
zh: 这个新城的规划非常漂亮。

en: Take this aspirin.
zh: 把这片阿司匹林吃了。

en: Please fix the iron.
zh: 请帮我修一下这个熨斗。

en: This T-shirt wore quite well.
zh: 这件T恤挺耐穿的。

en: This T-shirt is too small for me.
zh: 这件T恤我穿太小了。

en: I bought this T-shirt on sale.
zh: 这件T恤是我打折时买的。

en: How much is this T-shirt?
zh: 这件T恤多少钱？

en: I liked these T-shirts, and I bought three of them.
zh: 我挺喜欢这些T恤的，就买了三件。

en: This science-fiction novel is very interesting.
zh: 这部科幻小说挺有意思的。

en: This science fiction story seems interesting. Will you lend it to me when you have finished reading it?
zh: 这个科幻故事看着挺有意思，你读完能借我看看吗？

en: From tomorrow this email address will be invalid.
zh: 这个邮箱地址从明天起就失效了。

en: May I borrow this CD?
zh: 我能借这张CD吗？

en: Set the CD player square with the front edge of the shelf, please.
zh: 请把CD机和架子的前沿对齐放好。

en: This CD belongs to her.
zh: 这张CD是她的。

en: This food called BLT; what's in it?
zh: 这个叫BLT的东西里面都有啥？

en: I have been learning English these four years.
zh: 这四年我一直在学英语。

en: I'm looking forward to seeing you this April.
zh: 我很期待今年四月见到你。

en: Prices have been stable for the past three years.
zh: 过去这三年物价挺稳的。

en: I have eaten nothing for the past three days.
zh: 我过去三天什么都没吃。

en: It has kept raining for the past three days.
zh: 这雨连着下了三天了。

en: These three pretty girls are all nieces of mine.
zh: 这三个漂亮姑娘都是我侄女。

en: She has been out of work these two years.
zh: 她这两年一直没工作。

en: I haven't had time to do the dishes for two days; they are in a pile in the kitchen sink.
zh: 我两天没洗碗了，厨房水槽里堆了一堆。

en: At this second shock, I began to cry.
zh: 第二次受惊时，我哭了出来。

en: Who wrote these two letters?
zh: 这两封信是谁写的？

en: The two of them were never to meet again.
zh: 他们两人后来再也没见过面。

en: You should leave out these two lines.
zh: 你应该把这两行删掉。

en: These two are very different from each other.
zh: 这两个很不一样。

en: These two lines are at right angles.
zh: 这两条线是垂直的。

en: It is likely that these two consonants are in complementary distribution.
zh: 这两个辅音很可能是互补分布。

en: These two plans are alternative.
zh: 这两个方案是可以互相替代的。

en: It is not sufficient to describe the differences in attitude between these two ethnic groups.
zh: 光是描述这两个民族之间的态度差异是不够的。

en: Choose either of the two T-shirts.
zh: 这两件T恤你随便选一件吧。

en: I have been as busy as a bee for the past two months.
zh: 这两个月我忙得团团转。

en: In the course of the past year, prices have doubled.
zh: 在过去的一年里，物价翻了一番。

en: Read this passage and translate it into Japanese.
zh: 读读这段话，把它翻译成日语。

en: I want to change this dollar bill into ten dimes.
zh: 我想把这张一美元换成十个一毛钱的硬币。

en: In the past month, three houses, all in good condition, have been torn down.
zh: 在过去的一个月里，三栋状况良好的房子都被拆掉了。

en: In the last fifteen or twenty years, there have been great changes in family life in Britain.
zh: 在过去的十五到二十年里，英国的家庭生活发生了巨大的变化。

en: Could you give me some change for this ten dollar bill?
zh: 能帮我把这张十块钱换成零钱吗？

en: Could you break this ten dollar bill?
zh: 这张十块钱能帮我破开吗？

en: I'd like to break this 100 dollar bill into four 20 dollar bills and twenty singles.
zh: 我想把这张一百块钱换成四张二十的和二十张一块的。

en: I'm troubled by this birth-mark.
zh: 这个胎记让我挺苦恼的。

en: Those four words carried not only a lot of complex information, but also the persuasive force of a proverb.
zh: 那四个字不仅包含了复杂的信息，还像谚语一样具有说服力。

en: Proverbs are full of wisdom.
zh: 谚语充满了智慧。

en: As the proverb says, "Time is money."
zh: 俗话说，“时间就是金钱”。

en: The proverb runs as follows.
zh: 那句谚语是这么说的。

en: As the proverb goes, time really is money.
zh: 正如谚语所说，时间真的就是金钱。

en: Of all things, why did he give me a hat for my birthday? I don't wear a hat.
zh: 他干嘛偏偏送我帽子当生日礼物？我又不戴帽子。

en: The affair ran more smoothly than we expected.
zh: 事情办得比我们预想的要顺利。

en: It is difficult to ascertain what really happened.
zh: 很难弄清楚到底发生了什么。

en: My father will possibly come on the next train.
zh: 我爸可能会坐下一班火车过来。

en: Maybe you'd better come with us.
zh: 也许你最好跟我们一起去。

en: All things cooperated to make her pass the exam.
zh: 各种因素凑在一起，让她通过了考试。

en: It would be best to leave it to a man who knows the ropes.
zh: 这事儿最好交给懂行的人去办。

en: Handle the glasses carefully.
zh: 拿杯子的时候小心点。

en: Take care not to drop that glass.
zh: 当心别把那个杯子摔了。

en: Give the glasses a good boil.
zh: 把杯子好好煮一煮消毒。

en: There's many a slip 'twixt the cup and the lip.
zh: 事情没到最后，总会有变数。

en: I've chipped off a piece of the glass.
zh: 我把杯子磕掉了一块。

en: Take care not to break the glasses.
zh: 当心别把杯子打碎了。

en: Who broke the cup?
zh: 谁把杯子打碎了？

en: Please bring me some glasses.
zh: 请给我拿几个杯子。

en: The glass is full of water.
zh: 杯子里装满了水。

en: The glass is full of milk.
zh: 杯子里全是牛奶。

en: The glass is filled with milk.
zh: 杯子里盛满了牛奶。

en: The glass was broken to pieces.
zh: 杯子摔得粉碎。

en: There isn't any milk in the glass.
zh: 杯子里没有牛奶。

en: Don't pour hot water into the glass or it will crack.
zh: 别往玻璃杯里倒热水，不然会裂的。

en: Fill a glass with water.
zh: 往杯子里倒满水。

en: There is a little water in the glass.
zh: 杯子里有一点水。

en: My fingers left marks on the glass.
zh: 杯子上留下了我的指印。

en: There is little water left in the glass.
zh: 杯子里没剩多少水了。

en: There is a little milk in the glass.
zh: 杯子里还有点牛奶。

en: There is little milk in the glass.
zh: 杯子里几乎没有牛奶了。

en: There is little water in the glass.
zh: 杯子里几乎没水了。

en: The glass dropped from his hand.
zh: 杯子从他手里滑落了。

en: The glass broke to pieces.
zh: 玻璃杯摔得稀碎。

en: The glass crashed to the ground.
zh: 玻璃杯摔在了地上。

en: Give me a glass of water, please.
zh: 请给我来杯水。

en: I had a glass of beer to quench my thirst.
zh: 我喝了杯啤酒解解渴。

en: A face with too much make up looks strange.
zh: 妆化得太厚，看着挺怪的。

en: Come here and have a look at it.
zh: 过来看看这个。

en: Get over here and be quick about it!
zh: 赶紧给我过来，动作快点！

en: Will you please hold this edge?
zh: 能帮我拿一下这个边儿吗？

en: The locals around here really live at a relaxed pace.
zh: 这一带的本地人生活节奏真悠闲。

en: Put yourself in my position.
zh: 你站在我的立场上想想。

en: Come over here and join us.
zh: 过来和我们一起吧。

en: Turn the light over here, will you?
zh: 把灯往这边照照，行吗？

en: I steal into the house.
zh: 我偷偷溜进了屋里。

en: It's a snap once you get the hang of it.
zh: 只要找着门道，一下就学会了。

en: Stick at it, and you'll pass the exam.
zh: 坚持下去，你准能通过考试。

en: The cook served the family for many years.
zh: 那个厨师在这家干了好多年。

en: The cook broiled the meat.
zh: 厨师把肉给烤了。

en: As a cook he is in a class by himself.
zh: 当厨师，他绝对是一流的。

en: The cook hasn't put any on it.
zh: 厨师还没往上面加呢。

en: I think I'm starting to get the hang of it.
zh: 我觉得我开始摸着门道了。

en: Got the hang of it?
zh: 找到窍门了吗？

en: Overseas service here.
zh: 这里是国际台。

en: Can I chew on this side?
zh: 我能用这边嚼吗？

en: Don't fritter away your allowance.
zh: 别把你的零花钱乱花了。

en: Look at the boy and his dog that are coming this way.
zh: 看那个正往这边走的小男孩和他的狗。

en: If you happen to be out this way, be sure to call in at my house.
zh: 要是刚好路过这儿，一定来我家坐坐。

en: Please drop in on us when you come this way.
zh: 路过这儿的时候请来找我们玩。

en: This is Goroh Watanabe.
zh: 这位是渡边五郎。

en: This is my daughter.
zh: 这是我女儿。

en: This is the man of whom I spoke the other day.
zh: 这就是我前几天跟你说的那个人。

en: This is my cousin.
zh: 这是我表哥。

en: This is Wonder Music Shop.
zh: 这里是奇迹音乐店。

en: This is Tom speaking. I'd like to speak to Ann.
zh: 我是汤姆，我想找一下安。

en: This is Mr Smith speaking. Is Mr Johnson in?
zh: 我是史密斯，请问约翰逊先生在吗？

en: This is Ken. He really likes his dog.
zh: 这是肯，他真的很喜欢他的狗。

en: I hope you're enjoying your stay here.
zh: 希望你在这儿待得愉快。

en: This is the man for you to speak to.
zh: 他就是你要找的人。

en: This was quite primitive compared to that.
zh: 和那个比起来，这个也太简陋了。

en: It is very cold here all the year round.
zh: 这儿一年到头都很冷。

en: This is room No. 1025. Room service, please.
zh: 我是1025房，麻烦来一下客房服务。

en: If you should come this way again, please drop in.
zh: 要是你再路过这儿，请进来坐坐。

en: This one is prettier.
zh: 这个更漂亮一点。

en: This costs more than that.
zh: 这个比那个更贵。

en: Please bring this gentleman a glass of beer.
zh: 请给这位先生来杯啤酒。

en: I want you to keep up with me.
zh: 我希望你能跟上我。

en: We received an acknowledgement of our letter.
zh: 我们收到回信了。

en: I'm sorry to have troubled you owing to our mistake.
zh: 很抱歉，因为我们的失误给你添麻烦了。

en: We hope you will understand the difficult circumstances we're working under.
zh: 希望你能体谅我们现在的难处。

en: This is better by far.
zh: 这个好得多。

en: This register is out of commission.
zh: 这个收银台停用了。

en: If you're ever in the area, give me a call.
zh: 你要是来这附近，记得给我打个电话。

en: I made motions at him to come here with my hand.
zh: 我招手示意他过来。

en: Come here, and I'll show you.
zh: 过来，我给你看个东西。

en: Don't fail to call on me when you come this way.
zh: 你路过这儿的时候，千万记得来找我。

en: Get in touch with me as soon as you arrive here.
zh: 你一到这儿就联系我。

en: May I sit here?
zh: 我能坐这儿吗？

en: Be sure to look us up when you're in town.
zh: 你在城里的话，记得来找我们。

en: We have very big lotus leaves.
zh: 我们这儿的荷叶特别大。

en: There's no one by that name here.
zh: 这儿没这个人。

en: Could you sign here, please?
zh: 请在这儿签个名。

en: Please drop in when you come this way.
zh: 你顺路过来的话，请进来坐坐。

en: Be sure to call on me when you come this way.
zh: 你路过这儿时一定要来看我。

en: Be sure to drop in on us if you come our way.
zh: 你要是来我们这边，一定得过来坐坐。

en: We should take matters into our own hands.
zh: 我们应该亲自处理这件事了。

en: Is it for here?
zh: 是在这儿吃吗？

en: Is that to eat here or take out?
zh: 是在这儿吃还是带走？

en: Here or to go?
zh: 在这儿吃还是打包？

en: These are my shoes and those are yours.
zh: 这是我的鞋，那是你的。

en: This is the boy who showed me around the city.
zh: 就是这个男孩带我在这座城市逛的。

en: This is the couple who showed me the way.
zh: 就是这对夫妻给我带的路。

en: This is the boy whom I met there yesterday.
zh: 这就是我昨天在那儿碰见的男孩。

en: This is Mr Yasuda.
zh: 这位是安田先生。

en: This is the lady I spoke of yesterday.
zh: 这位就是我昨天说的那位女士。

en: We'll call Dr. Shiegal for you.
zh: 我们会帮你叫希格尔医生的。

en: This is the boy whose name is Tom Fisher.
zh: 这个男孩的名字叫汤姆·费雪。

en: Here is your key.
zh: 这是你的钥匙。

en: This is the girl you wanted to see.
zh: 这就是你想见的那个女孩。

en: This is Miss Curtis.
zh: 这位是柯蒂斯小姐。

en: Don't make a fuss.
zh: 别大惊小怪的。

en: We thoroughly enjoyed the delicious meal.
zh: 这顿饭我们吃得很开心。

en: Please eat up your dinner.
zh: 把晚饭吃完吧。

en: The fewer, the better.
zh: 人越少越好。

en: All the dinner had been eaten before he came.
zh: 他来之前，晚饭已经全被吃光了。

en: Of course you'll catch a cold if you fall asleep under the kotatsu. You have to learn to take care of yourself.
zh: 你在被炉里睡着了当然会感冒，你得学会照顾自己。

en: Don't say anything that might get you into trouble.
zh: 别说那些会让你惹上麻烦的话。

en: I felt relieved when all the troubles were taken care of.
zh: 麻烦都解决了，我也就放心了。

en: Never trouble till trouble troubles you.
zh: 麻烦不找你，你也别自找麻烦。

en: It is not necessary to be meticulous.
zh: 没必要那么谨小慎微。

en: Cosby's argument concerns the reliability of the Hette Manuscript.
zh: 科斯比的观点涉及赫特手稿的可靠性。

en: High costs made it hard to carry on his business.
zh: 高成本让他的生意很难维持下去。

en: Kozue thought the teacher's lecture was dull, boring and endless.
zh: 梢觉得老师讲得没完没了，枯燥又无聊。

en: Kozue has never given way to despair in her life.
zh: 梢这辈子从没向绝望低过头。

en: The small business man failed and his business went down for the count.
zh: 那个小商贩生意失败，彻底垮了。

en: You put far too much pepper in it.
zh: 你胡椒放得太多了。

en: Please pass me the pepper.
zh: 请把胡椒递给我。

en: Pepper burned his mouth.
zh: 胡椒辣到了他的嘴。

en: Prices are high here but that's because the after-sale service is really good.
zh: 这儿物价高，是因为售后服务真的很好。

en: Do you have many friends here in Japan?
zh: 你在日本有很多朋友吗？

en: There are so many people here in Tokyo.
zh: 东京的人可真多啊。

en: The Union of South Africa has had racial problems in recent years.
zh: 南非联邦近些年一直有种族问题。

en: The quality of their products has gone down over the years.
zh: 这些年，他们家的产品质量越来越差了。

en: The number of traffic accidents has increased in recent years.
zh: 这几年交通事故变多了。

en: The birthrate will continue to decline for years to come.
zh: 接下来的几年，出生率还会继续下降。

en: We've had all kinds of weather over the past few days.
zh: 这几天什么天气都碰上了。

en: It's been overcast for the past few days.
zh: 这几天一直是阴天。

en: For the past few days Jane has been quiet and out of humor.
zh: 简这几天话很少，心情也不太好。

en: It's been pouring here for the last few days.
zh: 这儿这几天一直在下瓢泼大雨。

en: The weather will remain cold for several days.
zh: 接下来的几天天儿还会一直挺冷的。

en: Her health has been declining these past months.
zh: 这几个月她的身体越来越差了。

en: Monetary policy in United States has been characterized by tight credit over the months.
zh: 美国这几个月的货币政策一直是信贷紧缩。

en: Koko herself cannot use spoken language, but she loves to listen to people's conversations.
zh: 可可自己不会说话，但她很喜欢听别人聊天。

en: The snow is very deep here in our town in January.
zh: 一月份的时候，我们这儿的雪积得特别深。

en: Prices have gone up these three months.
zh: 这三个月物价一直往上涨。

en: We've been having strange weather the past few years.
zh: 这几年的天气一直挺反常的。

en: Don't fail to come and see me one of these days.
zh: 找时间一定要来见见我啊。

en: What do you think were the year's ten biggest items of news?
zh: 你觉得今年的十大新闻都有什么？

en: Let's cross here.
zh: 咱们从这儿过马路吧。

en: The area the center of which is here was bombed.

en: The income from this source is tax-free.
zh: 这项收入是免税的。

en: There is a village about three kilometers up the river from here.
zh: 离这儿往上游三公里左右有个村子。

en: Where's the nearest restroom?
zh: 最近的厕所在哪儿？

en: I have a bad pain here.
zh: 我这儿疼得厉害。

en: This is Uncle Tom's farm.
zh: 这是汤姆叔叔的农场。

en: I have a pricking pain here.
zh: 我这儿扎着疼。

en: This is where the accident happened.
zh: 事故就是在这儿发生的。

en: This is the place where the incident took place.
zh: 这就是事发地点。

en: This is the room where the author killed himself.
zh: 这就是那个作家自杀的房间。

en: I have a throbbing pain here.
zh: 我这儿一跳一跳地疼。

en: I have a gripping pain here.
zh: 我这儿绞着疼。

en: This is the main street of this city.
zh: 这是这个城市的大街。

en: This is the place where the accident was.
zh: 事故就是在这儿发生的。

en: This is the place where the incident happened.
zh: 事情就是在这儿发生的。

en: Is this the place in which your mother works?
zh: 这就是你妈工作的地方吗？

en: This is where the concert took place the other day.
zh: 前几天的演唱会就是在这儿办的。

en: This is the coffee shop I first met my wife in.
zh: 这就是我第一次见到我老婆的那家咖啡馆。

en: This is the place where the battle of Hastings took place.
zh: 这就是黑斯廷斯战役发生的地方。

en: This is the place where the battle took place.
zh: 这就是那场战斗发生的地方。

en: How about a cup of cocoa?
zh: 来杯可可怎么样？

en: There hasn't been any rain for the past three months.
zh: 过去三个月都没下雨。

en: It has been the driest June for thirty years.
zh: 这是三十年来最干旱的一个六月。

en: I've had a nasal voice for two weeks.
zh: 我说话带鼻音都两周了。

en: Times have been bad these past few years.
zh: 这几年日子不好过。

en: During the past several years, many Japanese have been either killed or injured while traveling overseas.
zh: 在过去的几年里，很多日本人在海外旅行时遭遇伤亡。

en: It's quite an informal meeting.
zh: 这是一个比较随意的会议。

en: As a rule of thumb, you should plan on one pound of beef for every two guests.
zh: 凭经验来说，每两个客人你就得准备一磅牛肉。

en: Until quite recently, people in developed countries didn't care much about the environment.
zh: 直到最近，发达国家的人们才开始关注环境。

en: He is much better at sports than me, to say the least.
zh: 毫不夸张地说，他体育比我强多了。

en: She looks satisfied when she catches a cockroach.
zh: 她抓到蟑螂的时候一脸满足。

en: May I have a Coca-Cola?
zh: 我能来瓶可口可乐吗？

en: Cockroaches hide themselves during the day.
zh: 蟑螂白天都躲起来。

en: Coke has always been the top dog when it comes to soft drinks.
zh: 说到软饮料，可乐一直是老大。

en: Coca-Cola advertisements can be seen all over the world.
zh: 全世界都能看到可口可乐的广告。

en: The goals were placed at the opposite ends of the town.
zh: 球门设在镇子的两头。

en: The goal is still some distance away.
zh: 离目标还有一段距离。

en: The cola made my tongue tingle.
zh: 可乐喝得我舌头发麻。

en: Has all the coke been drunk?
zh: 可乐都喝光了吗？

en: More than one bottle of coke was consumed.
zh: 喝了不止一瓶可乐。

en: Go and buy three bottles of coke.
zh: 去买三瓶可乐。

en: Three coffees, please.
zh: 请来三杯咖啡。

en: The coffee break is an American institution.
zh: 喝咖啡休息是美国的一种传统。

en: Have some coffee?
zh: 喝点儿咖啡吗？

en: Give me a cup of coffee.
zh: 给我杯咖啡。

en: Will you have a cup of coffee?
zh: 你想来杯咖啡吗？

en: I'll put some coffee on.
zh: 我去煮点咖啡。

en: Will you make coffee for me?
zh: 能帮我煮杯咖啡吗？

en: I'd like my coffee after the meal.
zh: 我想饭后再喝咖啡。

en: Would you like to have some coffee?
zh: 你想喝点咖啡吗？

en: Bring me a cup of coffee, will you?
zh: 给我拿杯咖啡，行吗？

en: You've left your coffee. Don't you like it?
zh: 咖啡怎么没喝，是不喜欢吗？
